alert.note: Alert for Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Westmoreland County through 930 PM EDT... At 835 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Tilghman Island to Coles Point. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... University Of Maryland Center For Environmental Studies around 850 PM EDT. Cambridge around 855 PM EDT. Secretary around 905 PM EDT. Hurlock around 910 PM EDT. Vienna around 915 PM EDT. Deal Island around 925 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Wetipquin, Madison, Brookview, Trinity, Eldorado, Eden, Church Creek, Lloyds, Mount Vernon and Chesapeake Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
